comments.body: nit: we should may be make these tests derive from a common subsection to avoid updating the image name so many times. Not necessary for this PR though.
Agreed. It looks like @Random-Liu made some progress towards this sort of goal for some other config files in 3922dd666725a5420c85a71561790096e9226f5f, maybe he can do the same for these.

Compared to `gci-dev-55-8872-18-0`, the change-log also includes several other things:
- Fixed a bug in e2fsprogs that caused mke2fs to take a very long time (Upstream fix: http://git.kernel.org/cgit/fs/ext2/e2fsprogs.git/commit/?h=next&id=d33e690fe7a6cbeb51349d9f2c7fb16a6ebec9c2)
- Enabled various kernel modules needed for iptables and conntrack functionality to work correctly
- Updated docker image used by toolbox. It now comes with several networking tools pre-installed

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2,6 @@images:
  gci-density1:
    image: gci-dev-56-8977-0-0
    project: google-containers
    machine: n1-standard-1

comments.body: Are we running all the tests in parallel on different vm instances? Why?
Yeah, @coufon found that the benchmark result is not quite stable if we run them one after another. If we run them on the same VM, the result will be quite fluctuated.
Do we have enough quota in this project to run all of them in parallel?

Yeah, this only runs every 1-2 hours and the time is randomized.
Even if all test suites run at the same time: it will only need 57 nodes, the current quota is 100.
